etymology.description: 𠂇 ("left hand") + 又 ("right hand") = both hands -> traditional form 廾
etymology.interpretation: The character 廾 (gǒng, "two hands") represents the idea of both hands with 左(左) (zuǒ, "left") and 又(又) (yòu, "right") joined together. It visually indicates the concept of using two hands collectively, and stylistically resembles 八(八) (bā, "eight") at the bottom of some characters.

examples.chinese: 他用廾举起水杯(他用廾舉起水杯)。
examples.pinyin: Tā yòng gǒng jǔ qǐ shuǐ bēi。
examples.english: He lifted the water cup with his two hands.

examples.chinese: 孩子用廾抱住玩具(孩子用廾抱住玩具)。
examples.pinyin: Háizi yòng gǒng bào zhù wánjù。
examples.english: The child hugged the toy with his two hands.

examples.chinese: 他双手合拢时(他雙手合攏時)，仿佛呈现一个廾的形状(仿佛呈現一個廾的形狀)。
examples.pinyin: Tā shuāng shǒu hé lǒng shí, fǎngfú chéngxiàn yīgè gǒng de xíngzhuàng。
examples.english: When he clasped his hands together, it resembled the shape of 'gǒng' (two hands).
